title: Coinbase Pressures SEC for Crucial New Progress in Cryptocurrency Sector
body: US-based cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase is seeking regulatory approval from the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to offer blockchain-based stock trading. Speaking to Reuters, Coinbase chief legal officer Paul Grewal confirmed that the company has filed with the SEC to offer “tokenized shares” to its customers. The move would put Coinbase in direct competition with retail investment platforms like Robinhood and Charles Schwab, and it could also open up an entirely new line of business for the company. Tokenized stocks are created by converting traditional company shares into digital tokens. Investors do not own shares directly, but rather the tokens representing those shares. Advocates argue that this model could reduce transaction costs, make transactions instantaneous and enable 24/7 trading. Related News: BREAKING: Major Airdrop and Token Launch Announcement Released - Could Heat Up Competition But critics say there are significant challenges that need to be addressed before such digital assets become widespread. The World Economic Forum highlighted hurdles such as a lack of liquidity in secondary markets and a lack of global standards in a report last month. Tokenized stocks are not currently legally tradeable in the U.S., but some crypto companies have begun experimenting in this area. Last month, rival exchange Kraken announced tokenized versions of U.S. stocks it calls “xStocks,” which will be offered in select countries. In order for Coinbase to offer this service in the U.S., it would need to either obtain a “no-action letter” from the SEC or obtain certain exemptions. Such letters provide assurance that the SEC will not take enforcement action against a particular practice. Coinbase is not currently registered as a securities broker. The SEC filed a lawsuit against the company in 2023 for unlicensed securities trading, but that lawsuit was dropped this year under the Trump administration. *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: Coinbase Pressures SEC for Crucial New Progress in Cryptocurrency Sector

title: AgriFORCE Launches Gas-Powered Bitcoin Mining Site in Alberta, Plans Expansion to 1 EH/s
body: AgriFORCE Growing Systems (AGRI), a small agricultural firm that recently adopted bitcoin mining, has launched its first bitcoin BTC mining and digital compute site in Berwyn, Alberta, using stranded natural gas to power 120 mining machines. The site, developed with BlueFlare Energy, marks the company’s first operational milestone in a broader strategy to turn off-grid natural gas into energy-backed digital infrastructure. The Berwyn facility currently draws 425 kW and delivers more than 32 petahashes per second (PH/s) of compute power. A second phase under development will expand capacity by another 200 kW. BlueFlare’s systems monitor emissions and provide real-time telemetry through its proprietary OS and carbon tracking tech. The use of flared gas to mine bitcoin is one way miners are looking to use a cheaper source of energy to offset some of the margin squeeze hurting the industry. For several years, flared gas bitcoin mining has been a trend for miners to monetize otherwise wasted excess natural gas produced when oil and gas companies drill for fossil fuels. Read more: Bitcoin Mining Costs Soar as Hashrate Hits Records: TheMinerMag This deployment is part of AgriFORCE’s three-pronged strategy: mining bitcoin, building modular compute infrastructure, and monetizing energy directly. That approach gained traction with a new binding agreement between AgriFORCE and BlueFlare to expand operations to two additional Alberta sites, in Oyen and Hinton. Combined, these deployments could add 1.3 MW of natural-gas-powered compute, supporting tasks beyond bitcoin mining — such as AI model inference and edge computing for industrial devices. The model AgriFORCE is pursuing sidesteps grid dependencies by tapping unused energy reserves and bringing them online quickly. The company says it has already mined seven BTC across its Alberta and Ohio sites and plans to retain up to half of its bitcoin holdings while using the rest for operational expansion. AgriFORCE aims to scale to 1 exahash per second (EH/s) of compute capacity by Q1 2026, positioning itself as a player in the intersection of energy markets and decentralized infrastructure.

title: Ubyx Secures $10M Funding to Revolutionize Stablecoin Interoperability
body: BitcoinWorld Ubyx Secures $10M Funding to Revolutionize Stablecoin Interoperability The world of digital finance is constantly evolving, and at the heart of much of this innovation lies the potential of stablecoins. These digital currencies, pegged to stable assets like the US dollar, offer a bridge between the volatility of traditional cryptocurrencies and the stability required for everyday transactions. Yet, despite their promise, using stablecoins for payments often faces hurdles. This is where a new player, Ubyx , steps in, aiming to tackle a critical challenge: stablecoin interoperability. This ambitious blockchain startup recently announced a significant step forward, raising substantial seed funding to build a network designed to make crypto payments smoother and more accessible globally. What Problem is Ubyx Trying to Solve with Stablecoin Interoperability? Imagine you want to send a payment using one type of stablecoin, but the recipient’s platform only accepts a different one. Or perhaps you want to integrate stablecoin payments into your business, but connecting to various stablecoin networks and traditional financial systems is complex and costly. This lack of seamless connection is the core issue Ubyx is addressing. The current stablecoin landscape is somewhat fragmented: Multiple stablecoins exist (USDT, USDC, DAI, etc.), often on different blockchains. Integrating stablecoins with traditional banks and fintech applications is not standardized. Cross-border payments using stablecoins can still involve friction and intermediaries. Ubyx believes that true widespread adoption of stablecoins for payments hinges on solving this interoperability puzzle. They envision a world where stablecoins can flow easily between different networks and financial institutions, much like traditional currencies move between banks today. How Does Ubyx Plan to Build This Interoperability Network? According to reports, Ubyx plans to build a ‘global clearing system’. This isn’t just a simple bridge between two blockchains; it’s a more comprehensive network designed to connect the key players in the stablecoin ecosystem: Stablecoin Issuers: The entities that create and manage stablecoins. Banks: Traditional financial institutions that hold customer funds and handle settlements. Fintechs: Innovative financial technology companies building payment apps and services. By creating a standardized layer or network connecting these participants, Ubyx aims to facilitate easier clearing and settlement of transactions involving various stablecoins. This could significantly reduce the complexity and cost associated with using stablecoins for payments, whether for individuals or businesses. Think of it like the underlying infrastructure that allows you to use your debit card at different stores and ATMs, regardless of which bank issued the card. Ubyx is aiming to build a similar foundational layer for the stablecoin economy. Who is Backing This Blockchain Startup’s Vision? The recent funding round highlights significant confidence in Ubyx’s approach. The startup successfully raised $10 million in a seed round. This level of early-stage funding is substantial and signals strong investor belief in the team and their proposed solution. The round was led by Galaxy Ventures , the venture capital arm of Galaxy Digital, a prominent player in the crypto and blockchain space. Their leadership indicates a strategic investment aligned with the broader growth of the digital asset ecosystem. Equally noteworthy is the participation of other high-profile investors: Peter Thiel’s Founders Fund: Known for early investments in transformative technology companies. Coinbase Ventures: The investment arm of one of the world’s largest cryptocurrency exchanges, showing interest in infrastructure that could boost crypto usage. Paxos: A regulated blockchain infrastructure company and stablecoin issuer itself, bringing direct industry expertise. VanEck: A global investment manager with a growing focus on digital assets and blockchain technology. The presence of these diverse and influential investors — from traditional VC and crypto-native firms to stablecoin issuers and asset managers — underscores the perceived importance of solving stablecoin interoperability for the future of finance. What are the Potential Benefits of Improved Stablecoin Payments? If Ubyx’s initiative is successful, the impact on crypto payments could be significant: Reduced Friction: Easier movement of stablecoins between different platforms and systems. Lower Costs: Potentially fewer intermediaries and fees involved in stablecoin transactions. Increased Adoption: Making stablecoins simpler to use could encourage more businesses and individuals to accept and use them for everyday transactions. Faster Settlements: Blockchain technology inherently offers faster settlement times compared to traditional systems, a benefit enhanced by better interoperability. Innovation: A robust interoperability layer could spur the development of new financial products and services built on stablecoins. For businesses, this could mean easier integration of stablecoin payment options. For individuals, it could simplify sending money globally or making purchases using digital currencies without worrying about which specific stablecoin is required by the recipient. Are There Challenges for Ubyx and Stablecoin Interoperability? While the vision is compelling, building a global clearing system for stablecoins is no small feat. Ubyx will likely face several challenges: Regulatory Landscape: Navigating different regulations across various jurisdictions regarding stablecoins and payment systems will be complex. Adoption by Institutions: Gaining widespread buy-in and integration from traditional banks and large fintechs requires trust, compliance, and significant technical work. Competition: Other projects and companies are also working on improving crypto payment infrastructure and interoperability. Technical Execution: Building a secure, scalable, and reliable network capable of handling global transaction volumes is a significant technical challenge. Network Effects: The value of a clearing network increases with the number of participants. Ubyx needs to attract a critical mass of issuers, banks, and fintechs. Overcoming these hurdles will be key to Ubyx’s success in making stablecoin interoperability a reality. What’s Next for This Ambitious Blockchain Startup? With the $10 million in seed funding secured, Ubyx is now poised to accelerate the development of its network. The focus will likely be on building out the core technology, establishing partnerships with stablecoin issuers, banks, and fintech companies, and navigating the necessary regulatory pathways. The success of Ubyx could serve as a significant catalyst for the broader adoption of crypto payments . By reducing the technical and operational friction associated with stablecoins, they could help unlock the potential of digital currencies for everyday commerce and global remittances. It’s an exciting development in the ongoing evolution of finance, watching a blockchain startup like Ubyx tackle fundamental infrastructure challenges to pave the way for a more connected and efficient digital economy. Summary: Ubyx’s $10M Boost for Stablecoin Payments In conclusion, Ubyx’s successful $10 million seed funding round, backed by major players like Galaxy Ventures, Founders Fund, Coinbase Ventures, Paxos, and VanEck, represents a significant investment in the future of stablecoin interoperability. The company’s plan to build a global clearing system connecting stablecoin issuers with banks and fintechs aims to streamline crypto payments , reduce friction, and accelerate the adoption of digital currencies for everyday use. While challenges remain, the strong financial backing and the clear focus on solving a critical infrastructure problem position Ubyx as a key player to watch in the evolving landscape of digital finance and blockchain technology. To learn more about the latest stablecoin and crypto payments trends, explore our article on key developments shaping the future of digital currency adoption. This post Ubyx Secures $10M Funding to Revolutionize Stablecoin Interoperability first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

body: Even though Solana (SOL) is witnessing a ranging market, the sixth-largest cryptocurrency based on market capitalization is witnessing an uptick in active monthly users as they edge closer to the all-time high (ATH) level of 160 million. Some of the key factors contributing to this surge include Solana’s broader ecosystem and developer engagement, thanks to the network’s high speed and ultra-low fees to the tune of $0.02. title: Can the Real Cypherpunks Please Stand Up?
body: Am I the only one feeling a growing sense of cognitive dissonance in crypto right now? The crypto industry has always had revolutionary roots. It emerged in 2008 with the Bitcoin whitepaper, a direct response to the financial crisis that decimated livelihoods while protecting a systemically flawed, corrupt banking system. Bitcoin wasn’t just a technical innovation—it was a political and ideological statement. A signal that builders and thinkers were ready to challenge the status quo with tools, not just words. As someone who’s worked in crypto for years, I should be celebrating. Today, decentralized technologies are no longer on the fringe. Fintechs are adopting stablecoins. Bitcoin ETFs are trading on traditional exchanges. The average person has heard of blockchain. From Capitol Hill to Davos, crypto is no longer being laughed out of the room. But despite this surface-level “legitimacy,” I can’t help but feel that something essential is lost. The ethos of crypto—the cypherpunk values that got us here—is being diluted, co-opted, and in some cases, directly betrayed. The Cypherpunk movement’s core belief is that technology can and should be used to rebalance power—away from overreaching governments and monopolistic corporations, and toward individuals. Peer-to-peer networks, end-to-end encryption, censorship-resistant platforms—these aren’t buzzwords; they’re commitments to improve our society. Stripe acquiring crypto infrastructure startups? Great, but it doesn’t create legitimacy in the crypto industry. That’s a survival move by big fintech to stay relevant and improve their product offering. Circle going public is a corporate milestone, not a validation of crypto’s principles. A Bitcoin ETF may bring liquidity, but it doesn’t bring ideological alignment. These fintech brands aren’t leading a movement—they’re reacting to it. They’re trying to keep pace with the crypto-native upstarts that are quickly rendering their legacy models obsolete. Let’s not confuse acquisition with validation. Just because the suits are now interested in the tools we’ve built doesn’t mean they understand, respect, or intend to preserve the reasons those tools exist. Crypto wasn’t supposed to be another tool in the hands of the state. It is supposed to be the counterweight. So it's understandable that the recent uptick in political engagement and clearer regulatory frameworks—like the GENIUS Act —feels like progress. Applications like Coinbase and Polymarket are gaining household recognition. President Biden’s successor has even extended an olive branch to the industry. But somewhere along the way, many of us seem to have lost the plot. A glaring example? Coinbase’s recent sponsorship of a military parade affiliated with President Trump. This isn’t a partisan critique. It’s a principled one. Coinbase’s mission statement emphasizes that political causes are a “distraction from our mission.” Yet, in practice, the company has repeatedly aligned itself with political events—from sponsoring presidential inauguration funds to courting political favor with expedited hiring of ex-DOGE staffers. CEO Brian Armstrong’s recent solicitation of former DOGE employees is quite poignant: “If you are looking for your next mission after serving your country, consider helping create a more efficient financial system for the world at Coinbase.” That framing—tying Coinbase’s mission to the state—epitomizes the creeping fusion between crypto’s stewards and the very power structures we were meant to counterbalance. Yes, Coinbase is a publicly-traded company. Yes, it operates in a jurisdiction governed by laws and politics. But being compliant does not mean being co-opted. Sponsoring political events, aligning with political figures, and turning a profit from proximity to power undermines the ethical foundation of decentralized technology. And Coinbase is not alone. Crypto-funded super PACs are pouring money into elections at every level. Ripple is now a lobbying juggernaut in D.C. We’re still reckoning with the staggering corruption that was FTX—where political donations and influence-peddling were tools of manipulation, not participation. This is not a slippery slope. We’re already sliding. Cypherpunkism is more than an aesthetic or an ideology. It’s a commitment to building systems that make centralized power obsolete—not tolerated or negotiated with, but irrelevant. It’s about building tools that empower individuals, preserve privacy, and promote a more open and resilient society. Crypto founders, investors, and institutions need to revisit these roots. Blockchain’s purpose isn’t to replicate traditional systems with shinier branding at politicized military gatherings—it’s to fundamentally alter how those systems work. To create a future where financial freedom, privacy, and open access are not privileges, but defaults. Yes, we must engage with regulators. Yes, we must work within legal frameworks. But that is a far cry from becoming their cheerleaders. There’s a difference between navigating the system and being consumed by it. There’s a difference between playing the game and forgetting why you joined it in the first place. We owe it to the movement—and to ourselves—to remember why crypto exists. Not to appease governments, but to hold them accountable. Not to win political favor, but to render such favor unnecessary. Not to build brands, but to build freedom. The real cypherpunks are still out there. But it’s time we make our voices heard again.

title: Ferrari pushes second EV launch to 2028
body: Ferrari (NYSE: RACE) pushed back the launch of its second fully electric model from 2026 to at least 2028 due to weak demand for high-performance luxury electric vehicles. The world premiere of this first EV was scheduled for spring 2025, with initial customer deliveries expected in October 2026. Two sources who refused to be named due to the matter’s sensitivity claimed that the Maranello, Italy-based company delayed the plan for a second Ferrari EV twice. They mentioned that there was initially a one-year postponement, but the model will launch in 2028 at the earliest, adding that demand for high performance in the luxury EV sector was currently zero. One of the sources pointed out that although the lack of market interest remained a major problem, the delay would provide Ferrari additional time to further develop in-house technology for its second electric vehicle. The second source said the second EV model aligned more with the company’s strategy of delivering around 5,000 to 6,000 units over a five-year lifespan for a typical Ferrari model. Vigna says Ferrari will only show the ‘technological heart’ of its electric car Ferrari's pivot to electric is a classic case of chasing a trend without understanding the market's pulse. Low demand for high-performance luxury EVs? That’s a red flag. The elite want exclusivity, not just a shiny battery pack. Keep an eye on their execution. https://t.co/ijGrpBSlQC — 007ofWallST (@007ofWallSt) June 17, 2025 Vigna recently said Ferrari would only show its electric car’s “technological heart” in October as part of a three-stage unveiling process. However, an analyst who declined to be named said it sounded like there was some delay to Ferrari’s launch plan, as one could have expected to see the car itself at the meeting. Vigna also stressed that his company would continue to “enrich” its products, as Ferrari unveiled the 296 Speciale plug-in hybrid model and its convertible version in May. Internally, Ferrari’s second electric car was reportedly seen as the “real game changer” for its EV strategy. At the same time, the first car was more of a low-volume, symbolic milestone model that would meet its promise to launch its first EV in 2026. Ferrari’s first EV, which was co-designed by former Apple Chief Design Officer Jony Ive, will allegedly cost over $500K. One of the anonymous sources described it as an atypical model for Ferrari, saying it would be larger than usual, but it would not be an SUV. Ferrari’s Chief Executive Benedetto Vigna mentioned in February that the much anticipated first EV, a departure from its roaring petrol engines, would be presented at the company’s capital market day on October 9. Ferrari disclosed plans to continue offering petrol, hybrid cars, and EVs. Hybrid models, which it started to sell in 2019, made up 51% of Ferrari’s car sales last year. Aston Martin pushes back its first electric car from 2025 to 2026 Aston Martin also pushed back its first electric car from 2025 to 2026 due to low consumer demand. The company’s Chairman, Lawrence Stroll, said it was scheduled to launch a high-riding, four-wheel-drive electric GT in 2025, but consumer demand was not what it was when the plans were first outlined. He, however, confirmed that Aston Martin had designed four EVs but stopped short of confirming whether they were envisioned as direct replacements for the current line-up, which comprised three front-engined sports cars and the DBX SUV. The Aston Martin team said it will continue to use plug-in hybrid powertrains as a “bridging” technology for its customers as the company transitioned from pure-ICE to a pure-EV line-up. The British brand’s first PHEV was the mid-engined Valhalla supercar, which was scheduled for launch in the final quarter of 2024 with an electrified V8 arrangement supplied by Mercedes-AMG. Ineos founder Sir Jim Ratcliffe said consumers should have a choice, adding that automakers could not force them and that, at the moment, they were “voting with their feet” not buying high-end EVs. He recognized that not all consumers wanted luxury EVs but acknowledged that there was surely a use case for them. Lamborghini also said it would postpone the launch of its first electric model to 2029 instead of 2028, and Germany’s Porsche cut back its plans for EVs amid soft sales of its electric Macan SUV and Taycan models. Earlier this year, Maserati canceled plans for an electric version of its MC20 sports car. KEY Difference Wire helps crypto brands break through and dominate headlines fast

title: Good Asset, Bad Buy? Analysts Warn Price Alone Doesn’t Equal Value
body: Deutscher warned that high-quality tokens can become poor buys if prices rise too far without better fundamentals. Howard Marks emphasized that overpaying for any asset, even good ones, leads to poor investment outcomes. Both experts stressed that true value depends on price alignment with fundamentals, not hype or brand On June 17, crypto analyst Miles Deutscher posted a warning to investors on X, emphasizing that rising prices—even for high-quality assets—can reduce investment appeal if fundamentals stay the same. Miles Deutscher Warns: Even Good Crypto Assets Can Become Bad Buys at High Prices Deutscher wrote that an asset like $HYPE might offer strong value at $10 or even $30, but as its price climbs to $40 or $50 without a change in its underlying fundamentals, it becomes a weaker buy. “There will come a point where it becomes a ‘bad’ buy, despite being a good asset,” he said. He also reversed the logic, explaining that low prices can make even poor-quality tokens look attractive. title: UBS Issues Warning: Bearish USD JPY Forecast Post-BoJ Decision
body: BitcoinWorld UBS Issues Warning: Bearish USD JPY Forecast Post-BoJ Decision In the dynamic world of global finance, where currency movements can signal significant shifts in economic tides, attention is currently focused on the Japanese Yen and its performance against the US Dollar. Following the latest Bank of Japan (BoJ) policy decision, a major player in the financial sector, UBS, has reiterated its medium-term bearish stance on the USD JPY forecast . This perspective carries weight, prompting investors and traders to re-evaluate their positions and consider the potential implications for the broader market, including how macro trends influence asset classes like cryptocurrencies. What Prompted This UBS Forecast? UBS’s maintained bearish view isn’t a sudden shift but rather a reinforcement of their existing perspective, significantly influenced by the recent BoJ decision . The Bank of Japan’s policy meetings are closely watched events, often dictating the trajectory of the Japanese Yen. While market speculation often surrounds potential changes, the BoJ’s communication and actions provide the fundamental basis for expert analysis like that offered by UBS. Key factors contributing to UBS’s outlook likely include: Policy Divergence: Despite minor adjustments or signals, the fundamental difference in monetary policy between the BoJ and other major central banks (like the US Federal Reserve) remains a critical driver. While others have hiked rates aggressively, the BoJ has maintained a significantly looser stance, though recent moves hint at potential future shifts. Inflation Dynamics: The BoJ’s response to inflation, or lack thereof compared to peers, plays a vital role. UBS’s view suggests they believe the current policy path, shaped by the latest BoJ decision , will continue to weigh on the Yen relative to the Dollar in the medium term. Economic Outlook: Differing economic growth trajectories and outlooks between the US and Japan also feed into currency valuations. UBS’s analysis incorporates these macro factors when formulating their UBS forecast . Breaking Down the Latest BoJ Decision Understanding the specifics of the most recent BoJ decision is crucial for grasping UBS’s perspective. Central bank meetings involve evaluating economic data, assessing inflation risks, and deciding on interest rates and asset purchase programs. Market reactions often hinge on whether the decision meets, exceeds, or falls short of expectations, as well as the language used in the official statements and subsequent press conferences. Typically, a BoJ decision involves: Reviewing the current economic situation and price developments. Deciding on the policy interest rate (often negative in Japan). Setting targets for long-term government bond yields (Yield Curve Control). Providing forward guidance on the future path of monetary policy. UBS’s bearish stance indicates their interpretation of the latest decision suggests no immediate, significant catalyst for a sustained Yen appreciation against the Dollar in the medium term. They likely see the pace of any policy normalization as too slow or the policy divergence as still too wide. Why a Bearish Japanese Yen Outlook Matters A bearish Japanese Yen outlook has far-reaching implications beyond just currency traders. Japan is a major global economy and a significant player in international trade and finance. A weaker Yen affects: Japanese Exports: A weaker Yen makes Japanese goods cheaper for foreign buyers, potentially boosting exports. Japanese Imports: Conversely, imports become more expensive, impacting domestic consumers and businesses reliant on foreign goods. Global Carry Trade: The Yen has historically been used in ‘carry trade’ strategies due to low interest rates. A sustained weak Yen environment can influence global capital flows. Investment Flows: International investors evaluate the Yen’s strength when considering investments in Japanese assets (stocks, bonds) and vice versa for Japanese investors looking abroad. For those tracking global financial stability and market sentiment, the Japanese Yen outlook is a key piece of the puzzle. Exploring the USD JPY Forecast Factors Predicting currency movements is complex, involving numerous interconnected factors. The USD JPY forecast is influenced by a blend of economic indicators, central bank policies, market sentiment, and global events. UBS’s bearish view highlights specific elements they believe will dominate the pair’s movement. Consider these influencing factors: Factor Influence on USD/JPY (General) UBS’s Potential Interpretation Interest Rate Differentials (US vs. Japan) Higher US rates typically support USD vs JPY Differential remains significant, supporting USD strength medium-term. Inflation Data (US & Japan) Higher US inflation/lower Japan inflation supports USD vs JPY US inflation persists, Japan’s remains moderate, reinforcing policy divergence. Economic Growth (US & Japan) Stronger US growth vs. Japan supports USD vs JPY Relative growth dynamics favor USD in the medium term. Central Bank Communication (Fed & BoJ) Hawkish Fed / Dovish BoJ supports USD vs JPY BoJ language post-decision not hawkish enough to offset Fed stance medium-term. Global Risk Sentiment ‘Risk-off’ often supports JPY (safe haven), ‘Risk-on’ supports USD or other currencies Medium-term view less dependent on short-term sentiment swings, focuses on fundamentals. UBS’s Forex analysis synthesizes these factors to arrive at their conclusion. They likely see the enduring impact of interest rate differentials and the pace of monetary policy normalization as the primary drivers keeping them bearish on the pair over the coming months. Challenges to the UBS Forecast No forecast is without potential challenges or risks. While UBS maintains a bearish stance, several developments could potentially alter the trajectory of the USD JPY forecast : Faster BoJ Policy Shift: If the BoJ were to accelerate the pace of policy normalization (e.g., ending negative rates sooner, adjusting yield control more aggressively) in response to unexpected inflation spikes or economic strength, it could significantly strengthen the Yen. US Economic Slowdown: A more rapid or severe economic slowdown in the United States could lead the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates sooner or more aggressively than currently anticipated, narrowing the rate differential and weakening the Dollar against the Yen. Major Global Events: Geopolitical shocks or unforeseen global crises can trigger significant shifts in currency markets as investors seek safe-haven assets. The Yen is often considered a safe haven, though its role can vary depending on the nature of the crisis. Market Positioning: Extreme market positioning (too many traders heavily short or long the pair) can sometimes lead to sharp, counter-trend movements if positions are unwound rapidly. UBS’s Forex analysis would need to adapt if any of these factors materialized in a significant way. Investors should be aware of these potential headwinds to the bearish view. Actionable Insights from Forex Analysis What does this Forex analysis from UBS mean for market participants? While this is not financial advice, understanding institutional views provides valuable context: Monitor Central Banks: Keep a close eye on communications from both the BoJ and the US Federal Reserve. Any hints of policy shifts are critical. Track Economic Data: Pay attention to key economic releases from Japan and the US, such as inflation reports, GDP growth, and employment figures. Consider Time Horizon: UBS specifies a ‘medium-term’ view. Short-term fluctuations can still occur due to daily news flow or market sentiment. Risk Management: Any trading or investment decision based on a forecast like this requires careful risk management, including setting stop-losses and position sizing. A bearish USD JPY forecast from a major institution like UBS serves as a signal for market participants to refine their strategies and remain vigilant regarding incoming economic data and central bank commentary. Conclusion: Navigating the Japanese Yen Outlook UBS’s decision to maintain a medium-term bearish view on USD/JPY following the latest BoJ decision underscores the persistent influence of monetary policy divergence and economic fundamentals on this key currency pair. Their UBS forecast , rooted in detailed Forex analysis , points towards continued challenges for the Japanese Yen outlook against the US Dollar in the coming months. While potential risks and counter-arguments exist, the institution’s stance provides a clear perspective for investors navigating the complexities of the Forex market. Staying informed about central bank actions, economic indicators, and expert analysis is paramount for making informed decisions in this environment. To learn more about the latest Forex market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping the Japanese Yen outlook and other major currency pairs. This post UBS Issues Warning: Bearish USD JPY Forecast Post-BoJ Decision first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

title: Bitcoin Heads Lower as Trump Threatens to Assassinate Iran’s Supreme Leader
body: The U.S. may soon go to war against Iran, and crypto markets aren’t liking the prospect. Bitcoin BTC is down 3.8% in the last 24 hours, trading under $104,000 yet again. The CoinDesk 20 — an index of the top 20 cryptocurrencies by market capitalization, excluding stablecoins, exchange coins and memecoins — lost 6.1% in the same period of time, with ether ETH and solana SOL both slumping 7% and sui SUI dipping almost 10%. Crypto stocks are also taking a hit, with Coinbase (COIN), Strategy (MSTR) and Circle (CRLC) all down 2%-3%, and bitcoin miners such as Bitdeer (BTDR), Riot Platforms (RIOT), CleanSpark (CLSK), HIVE (HIVE) and Hut 8 (HUT) losing 6%-7%. The market move came as President Donald Trump suggested that the U.S. could soon get involved in the conflict between Israel and Iran. “We know exactly where the so-called ‘Supreme Leader’ is hiding,” Trump posted on social media, referring to Iranian head of state Ali Khamenei. “He is an easy target, but he is safe there - we are not going to take him out (kill!), at least not for now. But we don’t want missiles shot at civilians, or American soldiers. Our patience is wearing thin.” Trump also called for Iran to surrender unconditionally, and for residents of Tehran to evacuate the city. The national security council was convened, according to the White House, and Trump himself cut short a G7 summit to focus on the issue. Odds of U.S. military action against Iran before July have soared to 65% on Polymarket. “The sudden and severe escalation of the Iran-Israel conflict introduced a significant geopolitical risk premium, prompting an immediate flight from risk assets across the board, to which crypto has not proven immune,” said Javier Rodriguez-Alarcón, Chief Investment Officer at XBTO. “The geopolitical situation remains a wildcard; any credible de-escalation in the Middle East could serve as a significant risk-on catalyst, while a further deterioration would likely trigger another move down across risk assets,” he added. Matteo Greco, senior analyst at Finequia, shared the same sentiment, adding that the war could end up having significant consequences on the U.S. economic outlook. “Should Israeli military actions impact Iran’s oil production, a spike in oil prices could follow, fueling renewed inflationary pressures,” Greco said.

title: Ripple Makes Fresh Filing in the Quest to End XRP Lawsuit
body: Ripple Labs has submitted a new supplemental letter to Judge Analisa Torres in the Southern District of New York, reinforcing its push to finalize a negotiated settlement with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC ). This latest filing marks another step toward ending the long-running legal battle over XRP’s regulatory status. The update was first shared by prominent crypto legal analyst James K. Filan on X, who posted images of the court document filed on June 17, 2025 (Dkt. 988). In the letter, Ripple joins the previously submitted joint motion with the SEC and provides further clarification to support the request for an indicative ruling. Ripple Maintains Respect for the Court’s Prior Rulings In the letter, Ripple makes clear that it is not asking the Court to overturn or revise the Summary Judgment Order issued in July 2023. That landmark ruling found that Ripple’s institutional XRP sales violated securities laws, while programmatic sales on exchanges did not. #XRPCommunity #SECGov v. #Ripple #XRP @Ripple has filed a Supplemental Letter in support of the Motion for an Indicative Ruling. pic.twitter.com/yPTTugNIj8 — James K. Filan (@FilanLaw) June 17, 2025 Ripple states that the settlement does not seek to “absolve” it of compliance with securities laws. Rather, the company remains bound by the Summary Judgment and any future injunctions the Court may impose. The letter emphasizes that Ripple will continue to comply with all legal obligations, whether or not an injunction is ultimately issued. This clarification aims to dispel any misconceptions that Ripple is attempting to reverse the Court’s previous findings. Ripple Calls for Practical Resolution in Light of Evolving Regulation Ripple’s filing urges the Court to consider the broader benefits of approving the settlement. Specifically, it argues that the negotiated resolution would significantly reduce the burden on both Judge Torres’ docket and the Second Circuit’s, without disturbing the substance of the Court’s previous rulings. We are on twitter, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 — TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) July 15, 2023 The company also highlights the SEC’s evolving approach to digital assets. Citing the agency’s Crypto Task Force and recent comments on creating a “clearer path” for crypto regulation, Ripple argues that resolving the case through a settlement aligns with the broader regulatory shift. As one of the earliest crypto companies targeted by the SEC, Ripple contends that it has been subjected to disproportionately drawn-out litigation. The company believes a settlement would place it on equal footing with other firms whose cases were resolved much earlier or dismissed outright. With the supplemental letter now on record, attention turns to Judge Torres, whose forthcoming decision will determine whether the settlement can proceed. A favorable ruling could finally bring closure to one of the most high-profile legal battles in crypto history, while also setting a precedent for how similar cases might be resolved in the future. Ripple’s latest filing underscores its commitment to compliance, its desire for finality, and its ongoing efforts to help shape a more consistent and transparent regulatory environment for the broader crypto industry. title: Here’s What the Super Rich Are Increasing Their Investments In, According to BlackRock: Report
body: Family offices are reportedly investing a lot more in a certain type of alternative investment amid global uncertainty, according to the biggest asset manager in the world. Private credit is emerging as a top alternative asset for family offices, according to a new survey by BlackRock, reports Bloomberg. Of the 175 family offices around the world that were surveyed, more than half have a bullish outlook on private credit and nearly one-third say they are planning to increase allocations to the asset class this year. Says Armando Senra, head of the Americas institutional business at BlackRock, “They are diversifying their exposure within private markets. While allocations used to be primarily into private equity growth, now what you see is high interest in private credit, the beginning of interest in infrastructure.” The survey also finds that 30% of respondents plan to commit more of their money to the infrastructure market. Lili Forouraghi, BlackRock’s head of family offices, health care, endowments, foundations and official institutions in the US, says the super-rich are increasingly interested in the potential of private credit to generate a higher yield than public bond markets. She also says that infrastructure investments related to decarbonization and “the whole buzz of AI plus data centers, those are the areas that have intrigued a lot of our clients.” The survey finds that, on average, alternative investment comprises 42% of assets in family office portfolios, up from 39% in a prior 2022-2023 survey, and that private credit holdings make up anywhere from 15% to 30% of some family offices’ portfolios. title: Five Factors to Consider When Choosing a Crypto Market Maker
body: So you’ve got your project listed on a prominent exchange and drummed up some serious heat on social media – now all you have to do is find someone willing to lend their time, expertise, and most importantly, capital, to allow your coin to be traded with smooth, stable liquidity. This is where market makers come in. Market makers are companies which provide liquidity to financial markets (say, Bitcoin -USD) by using their own funds to buy and sell your coin at the predetermined market price. These entities are needed in financial markets because there might not be enough people in the world holding a specific financial asset to allow it to be traded instantly. Without market makers, traders could have to wait days, weeks, or even months to find someone willing to buy or sell an asset at the price you desire. In short, market makers ensure there’s always a liquidity pool available to enable efficient order execution, and stabilize token values by minimizing bid-ask spreads, and lowering volatility in general. Let’s take a quick look at ten important factors to consider when choosing a market maker. Reputation and Experience One of the first things to consider is the reputation and experience of the market maker in question. Have they handled assets in financial markets similar to yours before–- be they cryptocurrencies, DeFi tokens, or futures contracts? How did those markets perform under their guidance? There have been plenty of cases of market makers dumping their clients’ tokens or manipulating prices in an effort to profit off of unknowing retail investors. On the other hand, there are also a strong selection of industry stalwarts that have provided liquidity for diverse financial markets for decades. Companies like Caladan and Wintermute have years of experience managing liquidity for a variety of cryptocurrency tokens, throughout a constantly evolving regulatory landscape. Don’t just go by hype. Look at your market maker’s past record and judge them by their actions, not their words. Incentives and Payment Structure Market makers need to get paid. For some, this means profiting off the miniscule spread between token prices. It might only amount to a fraction of a cent, but when this is done for thousands of trades per day, it adds up pretty quickly. Other market makers simply take a monthly retainer. Some have been known to use a model known as “loan and option”. This is where the maker takes some of your tokens on loan and tries to profit from trading them. Naturally, this can cause conflict, since if the maker isn’t very confident in your project, they may end up selling your assets too soon, thus driving the price down. Make sure your market maker’s goals align with yours. It’s your responsibility to lay out clear rules, incentives and penalties to make sure they are working hard for your token or asset. Technology and Infrastructure Market making isn’t just a case of throwing money at an asset and hoping for the best. The most efficient market making firms utilize the latest, most advanced trading algorithms which can execute trades in mere milliseconds. What’s more, the best algorithms can react instantly to changing market conditions, moving quickly to balance the orderbook and keep prices stable. You should always investigate the level of technology used by a market maker, just as you’d inspect the engine of a new car. Find out if their tech can be applied to only centralized exchanges (like Binance or Coinbase), or also decentralized exchanges (like Uniswap). Is it compatible with your specific blockchain or token? Can it adjust rapidly if the market makes a sudden movement? Multi-Chain and Multi-Exchange Support Most modern cryptocurrency tokens don’t exist on a single network. The majority of newly-launched projects aim for multi-chain functionality, with tokens that are able to be transferred from Ethereum , to Polygon, to Binance Smart Chain, for example. This means that market makers must manage liquidity across all of these different networks, otherwise your asset could end up being priced differently on different platforms, causing market confusion and arbitrage risks. Modern market making firms like Caladan and Wintermute focus on providing liquidity across as many chains as possible. Caladan, for instance, integrates with over 70 centralized and decentralized exchanges, and its low-latency infrastructure, advanced algorithms, and extensive connectivity across CEXs and DEXs gives new token launches a way around the “cold start” problem. In other words, new tokens which are compatible across multiple networks can access deep liquidity from day one. Risk Management Risk is a given in financial markets, but good market makers will have plans in place to manage any risk that arises in various situations. When selecting a market maker, query their risk management strategies. Find out about their rules regarding stop-loss limits during market crashes, and which wallets are used in conjunction with the tokens they manage. What steps do the makers take to discourage or stop people from dumping large amounts of tokens into the market all at once? You’ll also want to know about how they store client assets. Do they use reputable custodians? Are they insured? Do they align with legal compliance rules, like KYC (know your customer) and AML (anti-money laundering) checks in the various jurisdictions they operate in? Final Thought Picking the right market maker is one of the most important decisions you’ll make after launching a token. It will affect how your token trades, how investors see your project, and whether you can attract serious partners down the line. Fortunately, there are several high-end market makers out there to choose from. So keep these five points in mind, and start making your market. Disclaimer: This article is provided for informational purposes only. It is not offered or intended to be used as legal, tax, investment, financial, or other advice.

title: Thailand Approves Exciting Five-Year Crypto Capital Gains Tax Exemption
body: BitcoinWorld Thailand Approves Exciting Five-Year Crypto Capital Gains Tax Exemption Are you invested in cryptocurrencies or considering it, especially with an eye on the Southeast Asian market? If so, there’s some truly exciting news coming out of Thailand that could significantly impact your investment strategy. The Thai government has officially approved a substantial five-year exemption on the capital gains tax for cryptocurrency investments. This move, effective immediately and running through 2029, is a landmark decision aimed at boosting the digital asset market within the country. Understanding the New Thailand Crypto Tax Exemption Let’s break down what this new policy actually entails. At its core, the approval grants a waiver on the 15% capital gains tax that was previously applicable to profits derived from cryptocurrency trading and investment. However, there’s a crucial condition: this exemption applies specifically to transactions conducted through licensed digital asset operators regulated by the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) of Thailand. This detail is key and underscores the government’s effort to encourage trading within the regulated financial ecosystem. The news, initially reported by Solid Intel on X (formerly Twitter), signals a clear intent from Thai authorities to foster a more favorable environment for digital asset investors and businesses. For years, the question of crypto tax Thailand has been a significant point of discussion and, at times, uncertainty for both domestic and international participants in the market. This five-year holiday on capital gains is arguably the most significant positive development on the taxation front to date. Previously, investors faced a potential tax burden on profits, which could act as a deterrent to active trading or long-term holding. The removal of this tax for a significant period could potentially unlock more liquidity and encourage greater participation in the market, assuming trades are conducted via approved platforms. Why Did Thailand Introduce This Capital Gains Tax Break? Governments introduce tax policies for various reasons, often related to economic goals. In the case of Thailand crypto tax policies, this exemption appears to be driven by a desire to: Stimulate the Domestic Digital Asset Market: By reducing the tax burden, the government makes crypto investment more attractive compared to other asset classes or compared to investing in crypto in jurisdictions with higher taxes. Encourage Use of Licensed Platforms: The condition that the exemption only applies to transactions on licensed exchanges is a direct incentive for investors to move away from potentially risky or unregulated platforms towards those overseen by the SEC. This enhances investor protection and regulatory oversight. Attract Foreign Investment: A favorable tax environment can make Thailand a more appealing destination for international crypto investors and businesses looking to establish a presence in Southeast Asia. Foster Innovation: A thriving digital asset market can spur innovation in blockchain technology, fintech services, and related industries within Thailand. This move aligns with Thailand’s broader ambition to become a digital hub in the region. By addressing one of the major concerns for investors – taxation on profits – they are signaling a commitment to integrating digital assets into the formal financial system. Who Benefits from the Thailand Capital Gains Tax Exemption? The primary beneficiaries of this policy are investors trading cryptocurrencies and other digital assets through licensed platforms in Thailand. This includes: Individual Retail Investors: Thai citizens and residents trading on platforms like Bitkub, Satang Pro, Zipmex (if operating under license), and others approved by the SEC. Institutional Investors: Funds and corporations investing in digital assets via licensed Thai operators. Licensed Digital Asset Operators: Exchanges and brokers will likely see increased trading volume and potentially new users attracted by the tax benefit, reinforcing their position within the regulated framework. It’s crucial to remember the ‘licensed operator’ condition. Trading on peer-to-peer platforms, foreign exchanges not licensed in Thailand, or engaging in direct wallet-to-wallet transfers where the gain isn’t realized through a licensed entity might not qualify for this exemption. Investors need to verify the regulatory status of the platform they use. Are There Any Caveats or Remaining Crypto Tax Obligations in Thailand? While the crypto tax exemption on capital gains is significant, it’s not a complete tax holiday on all crypto-related income. Investors and users of digital assets in Thailand still need to be aware of other potential tax liabilities: Income Tax on Other Crypto Activities: The exemption specifically targets capital gains from trading/investment. Other forms of income derived from crypto activities may still be subject to income tax. This could include income from: Mining rewards Staking rewards Airdrops (depending on classification) Income from providing liquidity in DeFi protocols Income received in crypto for goods or services These types of income are generally treated as assessable income under personal or corporate income tax laws and are taxed at standard rates. VAT on Transactions: While initial proposals sometimes included VAT discussions, the primary focus of this exemption is on capital gains. It’s important to stay updated on any potential Value Added Tax implications, though typically, the focus has been on the income/capital gains aspect. Definition of Capital Gains: While generally understood as profit from selling an asset for more than its purchase price, the specific interpretation within the Thai tax code for digital assets, especially complex scenarios like crypto-to-crypto trades, needs careful consideration. Trading on licensed exchanges simplifies this as the platform usually provides clear transaction records. Therefore, while the major hurdle of capital gains tax on trading profits via licensed platforms has been removed for five years, it is essential for investors to understand their tax obligations regarding other potential sources of crypto income and to maintain diligent records. How Does This Compare to Other Thailand Crypto Regulations? This tax exemption is part of a broader landscape of Thailand crypto regulations that have been evolving over the past few years. Thailand has been relatively proactive in regulating the digital asset space compared to some of its neighbors, establishing a clear legal framework under the purview of the SEC and the Ministry of Finance. Key aspects of Thailand’s regulatory approach include: Licensing Framework: Requiring digital asset exchanges, brokers, and dealers to obtain licenses and adhere to strict operational and security standards. Investor Protection: Implementing rules around customer suitability, risk disclosure, and asset custody. AML/CFT Compliance: Mandating robust Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Financing of Terrorism measures for licensed operators. The tax exemption complements this regulatory structure by making the regulated path significantly more appealing financially. It’s a carrot-and-stick approach: regulate the industry stringently (the stick) but offer a significant tax break for operating and trading within that regulated space (the carrot). Compared to some countries that have imposed strict bans or high taxes on crypto trading, Thailand’s approach seems geared towards integrating digital assets into the formal economy while mitigating risks. Other countries in the region, like Singapore, have different tax treatments, often not taxing capital gains for individuals unless trading constitutes a business. Malaysia also generally doesn’t tax capital gains, but income from crypto-related business activities is taxable. Thailand’s five-year exemption provides a specific, time-bound advantage for trading on its licensed platforms. Actionable Insights for Investors in Thailand Given this significant development regarding Thailand capital gains tax on crypto, what should investors do? Verify Platform Licensing: Ensure that any platform you use for buying, selling, or exchanging cryptocurrencies in Thailand is officially licensed by the Thai SEC. A list is usually available on the SEC’s official website. Consolidate Trading on Licensed Platforms: If you currently trade on foreign or unlicensed platforms, consider moving your activities to a licensed Thai operator to benefit from the capital gains tax exemption. Understand Other Tax Obligations: Don’t assume all crypto income is tax-free. Identify if you have income from staking, mining, airdrops, or other activities and understand how these might be taxed under standard income tax rules. Maintain Meticulous Records: Even with the capital gains exemption, keeping detailed records of all transactions (dates, amounts, prices, platform used) is crucial for demonstrating eligibility for the exemption and for calculating any other potential tax liabilities. Seek Professional Advice: Tax laws can be complex, especially concerning digital assets. Consult with a tax professional familiar with Thai tax law and cryptocurrency to ensure full compliance. This five-year window provides a fantastic opportunity for investors to potentially increase their net returns from trading activities without the drag of capital gains tax, provided they navigate the regulated landscape correctly. What Happens After 2029? The exemption is set to expire at the end of 2029. This raises questions about the future of crypto tax Thailand policies. Will the exemption be extended? Will a different tax regime be introduced? It’s impossible to say for certain, but the government will likely evaluate the impact of this exemption on the market, tax revenue, and regulatory compliance over the next few years. The hope is that by 2029, the Thai digital asset market will be more mature, with a larger user base primarily operating within the regulated ecosystem. This might make future taxation policies easier to implement and enforce. Investors should view this five-year period as a valuable opportunity while staying aware that the tax landscape could change in the future. Conclusion: A Bold Step for Thailand’s Digital Economy The approval of a five-year Thailand crypto tax exemption on capital gains for transactions on licensed platforms is a significant and positive development for the country’s digital asset ecosystem. It demonstrates the government’s willingness to use tax policy to foster growth and encourage participation within a regulated environment. For investors, it presents a substantial opportunity to trade and invest without the burden of capital gains tax until 2029, provided they utilize SEC-licensed operators. While the exemption is a major win, investors must remain mindful of other potential tax obligations related to different types of crypto income and ensure they comply with all existing Thailand crypto regulations . This move positions Thailand as an increasingly attractive jurisdiction for digital asset activities in Southeast Asia and signals a promising future for the integration of cryptocurrencies into the mainstream Thai economy. To learn more about the latest altcoin trends, explore our articles on key developments shaping altcoins price action. This post Thailand Approves Exciting Five-Year Crypto Capital Gains Tax Exemption first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

title: Bitcoin Price Slips Below $104K as Trump Makes Critical Remarks on Iran-Israel Conflict
body: Bitcoin’s price actions took another turn for the worse in the past several hours as the adverse developments on the Middle East front continue to unfold with more attacks and threats. The latest statements from the POTUS indicated that the US has “complete and total control of the skies over Iran,” and he also demanded the country’s “unconditional surrender.” Following the initial statement, Trump added on his social media platform that they knew “exactly where the so-called ‘Supreme Leader’ is hiding.” Although the US President said he is an easy target, he reassured that the ‘Supreme Leader’ is “safe there – we are not going to take him out (kill), at least not for now.” He warned that the US’s patience is “wearing thin” and later demanded that Iran surrender unconditionally. Bitcoin’s price, which has already been impacted on numerous occasions by the quickly evolving developments in the Middle East, started to lose value in the past several hours once again. The asset plunged to a five-day low of under $103,500 minutes ago, which meant a daily drop of roughly $5,000. BTCUSD. Source: TradingView Santiment also weighed in on the matter by highlighting BTC’s price drop to new weekly lows. However, the analytics platform said the inflows into the Bitcoin ETFs “remain strong,” as the financial products have seen nearly $1.5 billion poured in since June 9. Even with Bitcoin slipping below $104K Tuesday, Bitcoin ETF’s remain strong. Working on a 5-day net inflow streak, there has been a total of just over $1.464B in money moving into $BTC ‘s ETF’s, dating back to June 9th. pic.twitter.com/2sci1ARUdn — Santiment (@santimentfeed) June 17, 2025 The post Bitcoin Price Slips Below $104K as Trump Makes Critical Remarks on Iran-Israel Conflict appeared first on CryptoPotato .

title: Can Tron price surge 60% and revisit December highs?
body: Tron price remained consolidated on Tuesday as investors reflected on the new public listing news. Tron ( TRX ) was trading at $0.2790, a few points above this week’s low of $0.2670. It has risen by almost 40% from its lowest level this year. The biggest Tron news is that it will execute a reverse merger with SRM Entertainment , a company that sells branded toys. Dominari Securities, a company with ties to the Trump family, is arranging this merger. The merger will see SRM accumulate TRX tokens, mimicking the strategy of Strategy, which transformed from a small tech company into the largest Bitcoin ( BTC ) holder. Strategy’s market capitalization has soared from $1 billion in 2020 to $105 billion today. The deal comes after the successful Circle IPO , which has pushed its market capitalization to over $33 billion. Other companies in the crypto industry, like Gemini, Galaxy Digital, and Kraken, are also considering going public late this year. You might also like: Tron’s $210m Nasdaq play is real. Eric Trump’s role? Not so much. Tron has grown into one of the largest cryptocurrencies, with a market capitalization of over $24 billion. It is also the second most profitable crypto project after Tether. According to TokenTerminal data , Tron has generated over $3.65 billion in revenue over the past 365 days, with $1.6 billion recorded so far this year. Most of these fees are either burned or distributed to super representatives. The token-burning mechanism contributes to Tron’s deflationary nature. Its circulating supply has dropped from 96.3 billion in June last year to 94.8 billion today. Tron price technical analysis TRX price chart | Source: crypto.news The daily chart shows that TRX has been in a gradual uptrend in recent months, rising from a February low of $0.20 to $0.2743 today. The price has moved above the 50-day and 100-day Exponential Moving Averages (EMAs), signaling that bulls remain in control. Tron has also formed a cup-and-handle pattern, a popular continuation formation, and is currently developing the handle portion. If the pattern holds and TRX breaks above the year-to-date high of $0.2958, a continuation rally toward last year’s high of $0.4497, a roughly 60% upside, becomes increasingly likely. You might also like: Sei price may crash 22% and then rebound

title: Observability Startup Coralogix Unlocks Unicorn Status and Ambitious India Growth Plan
body: BitcoinWorld Observability Startup Coralogix Unlocks Unicorn Status and Ambitious India Growth Plan In the dynamic world of technology and investment, significant developments frequently capture attention. A notable event in the tech startup scene involves Coralogix, an Israeli company specializing in full-stack observability and security. Coralogix recently announced a substantial funding round, propelling it to unicorn status and signaling ambitious plans, particularly focused on the burgeoning Indian market and advancements in AI technology. This news is highly relevant to anyone following the tech investment landscape, including those interested in the broader implications for innovation and global market strategies. Coralogix Secures Significant Startup Funding Coralogix has successfully closed a Series E funding round, raising an impressive $115 million. This all-equity, all-primary round was led by NewView Capital, a venture growth firm based in California. Prominent participants included the Canada Pension Plan Investment Board and NextEquity, a venture firm founded by former Apple executives Avie Tevanian and Fred Anderson. Existing investors also contributed to this round. This latest funding round values Coralogix at over $1 billion pre-money, nearly doubling its valuation in just three years since its last funding in 2022. Achieving unicorn status is a significant milestone for any startup, reflecting strong market traction and investor confidence in its technology and future prospects. The Growing Importance of Observability Data Observability has become increasingly critical in today’s technology landscape. As companies store and leverage vast amounts of data, particularly to capitalize on the benefits of AI, understanding system behavior and performance is paramount. Observability platforms provide insights into the health and performance of complex systems, allowing teams to identify and resolve issues quickly. However, analyzing complex data streams and diagnosing problems can be time-consuming and resource-intensive. This is where innovative solutions like those offered by Coralogix play a crucial role, simplifying the process and making data more accessible and actionable for various stakeholders within an organization. Introducing Coralogix’s AI Agent: Olly Coralogix is addressing the challenge of data analysis with its advanced AI Agent named Olly. Olly is designed to automate data observability, making it easier for companies to understand complex issues using simple text prompts. The agent utilizes a semantic layer that incorporates both internal data, such as metadata, and external sources, including information from the internet. Olly can help users understand complex problems, like identifying the root causes of slow service or resolving common system errors. According to Coralogix co-founder and CEO Ariel Assaraf, Olly is trained to answer broader questions beyond just identifying what is wrong. It can assist customers in understanding which features cause frustration, how much those customers pay, or who their relevant account representative is. Key features of the Olly AI Agent include: Anomaly detection Access monitoring Real-time alerts These features automate data observability, providing proactive insights and reducing the manual effort required for monitoring and troubleshooting. The development of Olly is a key focus for Coralogix, and a portion of the new capital will be used to expand its AI research center responsible for its creation. Strategic India Expansion Plans A major focus for Coralogix following this funding round is a significant India Expansion . The startup plans to invest approximately $100 million in India over the next five years. This investment is aimed at leveraging India’s strong engineering talent pool to support its AI ambitions and overall growth. The expansion involves: Expanding its existing office in Gurugram. Hiring additional staff in Bengaluru and Mumbai. Building engineering, R&D, and customer success teams. Coralogix currently has about 100 employees in India out of a total headcount of nearly 550. The company plans to double its Indian employee base over the next three years. CEO Ariel Assaraf highlighted the cultural fit between Israeli and Indian engineering teams, describing it as a ‘get-it-done, very independent, very committed to the mission’ type of engineering culture that aligns well with Coralogix’s needs. India: A Key Market and Talent Hub India represents Coralogix’s second-largest market in terms of revenue and user base, following the U.S. The company serves over 100 customers in India, including prominent names like Postman, Jupiter Money, Meesho, BookMyShow, BharatPe, CoinDCX, and Razorpay. Coralogix also serves banks and enterprises in India and is looking to secure the Indian government as a potential large client. Beyond hiring, Coralogix is also considering the acquisition of Indian startups as a strategy to accelerate its footprint and acquire strong core teams for its expanding engineering operations. While discussions have occurred, no deals have been finalized yet. Growth Trajectory and Future Outlook Since its Series D round in June 2022, Coralogix has experienced substantial growth, reporting a 7x increase in revenues. Despite this rapid growth, the company is not yet profitable. Coralogix views Datadog as its primary competitor in the market. Looking ahead, Coralogix has set its sights on a U.S. IPO on Nasdaq within the next three years. The company aims to demonstrate significant progress on key initiatives – its unique architecture, customer engagement models, expansion into new geographies like India, and its innovative AI experience (both monitoring AI systems and using AI for monitoring) – before pursuing the public offering. This latest Startup Funding round provides Coralogix with the capital needed to accelerate these strategic initiatives, particularly its expansion in India and the continued development of its AI capabilities, positioning the company for further growth and a potential future IPO. Summary: Coralogix’s $115 million Series E funding round not only solidifies its status as a unicorn but also fuels significant expansion plans, with a major focus on investing $100 million in India over five years to build engineering, R&D, and customer success teams. The company is also heavily investing in its AI observability agent, Olly, leveraging the new capital to expand its AI research center. With India already being its second-largest market and a strong talent pool, Coralogix is strategically positioned for continued growth, eyeing potential acquisitions in the country and a future IPO on Nasdaq. To learn more about the latest AI market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping AI features. This post Observability Startup Coralogix Unlocks Unicorn Status and Ambitious India Growth Plan first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

title: Sonic token crashes to new lows: can it recover?
body: Sonic is currently flashing critical red-alert signals on the chart, with price action breaking below the yearly swing low and hovering at a key decision point. The market structure remains decisively bearish, and unless bulls step in at this final support, a breakdown toward $0.12 becomes the dominant scenario. Sonic is trading at its lowest level of the year, having breached the previous swing low, a significant structural support. This places SONIC ( SONIC ) at a high-risk inflection point where bulls must defend or risk triggering a full-blown bearish expansion. While a swing failure pattern could still be confirmed with a rapid recovery, the current trend, marked by lower highs, lower lows, and weak volume, paints a fragile picture. Key technical points Swing Low Break Signals Weakness: Price is now trading below key yearly support, increasing downside risk. $0.49 Resistance or $0.12 Breakdown: A recovery could target $0.49, but a failure to hold current levels may trigger a bearish move to $0.12 (Fibonacci extension). No Volume Support Yet: Bullish volume remains absent, reducing the probability of a reversal without significant demand. SUSDT (1D) Chart, Source: TradingView Price action on Sonic has continued to deteriorate, with the asset now closing below the prior swing low, establishing a new yearly low. This is a strong bearish signal, especially given the consistent pattern of lower highs and lower lows that has dominated the chart in recent weeks. The current zone is a make-or-break level. A bullish recovery from here would form a swing failure pattern (SFP), where price reclaims the broken low and rallies. If confirmed with a spike in volume, this would likely trigger a move back toward the $0.49 resistance, a level that has previously held on higher timeframes. You might also like: Pepe price down 13% on Tuesday: is a crash coming? However, if the price continues to close weakly below this last line of defense, the probability of a further breakdown sharply increases. The next major target lies at $0.12, based on the Fibonacci extension of the latest bearish swing. Currently, volume is not supporting a bullish reversal. There’s been no sign of meaningful buy-side participation, and without that, the path of least resistance remains to the downside. What to expect in the coming price action Sonic is at a critical inflection point. Bulls must reclaim the broken support zone quickly to prevent a deeper collapse. If support fails, expect price to target the $0.12 region in the coming weeks. Until volume returns and structure shifts, bearish momentum remains in control.
